pull.title: [copyright] add MIT license headers to .sh scripts where missing

events.message:
[copyright] add MIT license headers to .sh scripts where missing

Years are set according to 'git log' history

events.body:
ACK

Also a perma-ACK from me to add the appropriate license header to all code I have contributed or will contribute to bitcoin/bitcoin.
ACK, I think this is ready.

issue.title: Copyright headers for build scripts
issue.body:
This needs sign-off from: ~~@morcos @anddam~~ @brandondahler ~~@btcdrak @casey~~ @theuni @cozz ~~@dcousens @ers35 @EthanHeilman @gavinandresen~~ @gmaxwell ~~@jamesob~~ ~~@jgarzik @jonasschnelli~~ @jtimon ~~@joshtriplett~~ @kazcw ~~@maraoz~~ @MarcoFalke ~~@maaku~~ @TheBlueMatt @fanquake ~~@musalbas~~ @pstratem ~~@paveljanik~~ @Diapolo ~~@sipa @rnicoll @SergioDemianLerner @sdaftuar @laanwj @yurizhykin @dexX7 @nomnombtc @ntrgn @ptschip @randy-waterhouse @sinetek~~

~~@knocte~~ @joshtriplett 

~~@ajtowns @dooglus @onlyjob @wtogami~~ @imwuzhh

Permission from Tim Kosse has already been obtained:

```
[22:45:45] <codesquid> yes, shouldn't be an issue to put this one under MIT license
```

issue.title: Mandatory copyright agreement
issue.body: All contributions to the repository will agree to use the MIT license.

issue.title: Update git subtree check shell script
issue.body:
This include a series of ports from core that update `.sh` scripts inside `contrib/devtools`

bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8700
bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10771
bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11391 (partial)
bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11649

issue.title: Lint fixes
issue.body:
Fixes most lints currently reported by `test/lint/lint-all.sh`.

Includes changes cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8700
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8840
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9867
  - We backported the second commit in zcash/zcash#3146
- bitcoin/bitcoin#10771
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11394
- bitcoin/bitcoin#11649
- bitcoin/bitcoin#17329
- bitcoin/bitcoin#19258

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.
